instructions.value: Please complete all required fields. Fields marked with N/A option can be skipped if not applicable to your procurement.
instructions.notes: Initial guidance text displayed at the top of the form

titleOfITNeed.value: Enterprise Cloud Migration and Security Enhancement
titleOfITNeed.notes: Short descriptive title of the procurement need

projectDescription.value: Migration of on-premise infrastructure to Azure cloud platform with enhanced security controls and disaster recovery capabilities. Includes modernization of legacy applications and implementation of zero-trust architecture.
projectDescription.notes: Comprehensive overview of the procurement scope and objectives

additionalComments.value: This project aligns with the agency's digital transformation roadmap and must be coordinated with the ongoing cybersecurity initiative.
additionalComments.notes: Any supplementary information relevant to the procurement

requestorEmail.notes: Email of the person submitting the procurement request

requestorName.notes: Full name of the person submitting the request

agencyName.notes: Official name of the requesting agency

divisionOfficeName.notes: Specific division or office within the agency

projectOwnerEmail.notes: Email of the designated project owner or sponsor

projectOwnerName.notes: Full name of the project owner responsible for delivery

projectQ1SoftwareOrSaaS.notes: Indicates if procurement includes software or SaaS solutions

projectQ2NewTechOrPlatformChange.notes: Confirms introduction of new technology or platform migration

projectQ3FeasibilityOrPOC.notes: Not a feasibility study - this is for production implementation

projectQ4OutsourcedBusinessFunctions.notes: Some IT operations will be managed by the vendor

projectQ5GrantFunded.notes: Funded through regular agency budget allocation

projectQ6LegislativelyMandated.notes: Strategic initiative but not legislatively mandated

projectQ7CreditCardProcessing.notes: No credit card processing capabilities required

projectQ8NetworkOrInfrastructureChanges.notes: Significant network architecture changes for cloud connectivity

projectQ9NewITServiceOffering.notes: Establishing new cloud platform services for the agency

projectQ10ServerUpgradesWithMigration.notes: Migrating from physical servers to cloud infrastructure

projectQ11DataMigrationToNewTech.notes: Comprehensive data migration from legacy systems to cloud

problemStatement.value: The agency currently operates aging on-premise infrastructure with limited scalability, high maintenance costs, and inadequate disaster recovery capabilities. Current systems are approaching end-of-life and cannot support modern security requirements or the growing demand for remote access. This creates operational risks and prevents the agency from delivering efficient digital services to constituents.
problemStatement.notes: Detailed description of the current situation and challenges

keyFeaturesNeeded.value: Cloud infrastructure (IaaS/PaaS), automated backup and disaster recovery, multi-factor authentication, role-based access control, security information and event management (SIEM), application modernization services, 24/7 technical support, compliance with NIST 800-53 controls, data encryption at rest and in transit, API management platform.
keyFeaturesNeeded.notes: List of essential capabilities and requirements for the solution

needByDate.notes: Target date when the solution must be operational

touchdown_proposedEndDate.notes: Estimated completion date for full project implementation

ariba_targetAwardDate.notes: Target date for contract award to selected vendor

touchdown_projectDuration12to18Months.notes: Project expected to take less than 12 months

solicitationVehicleType.notes: Request for Proposal selected due to complex solution requirements

sectorIndustry.notes: Primary industry sector for this procurement

productOrService.value: Cloud Infrastructure Migration and Security Services
productOrService.notes: High-level description of what is being procured

td_qualifier_oneTimeBudgetRequired.notes: Significant upfront investment for migration required

ariba_approvedBudgetOrBaseValue.notes: Base contract value of $2.5M for initial implementation

ariba_estimatedTotalContractValue.notes: Total contract value including 3-year operational support

touchdown_projectRiskLevel.notes: Moderate complexity with established cloud migration methodologies

marketResearchDescription.value: Conducted analysis of cloud providers used by other state agencies including California, Texas, and New York. Reviewed Gartner Magic Quadrant for Cloud Infrastructure. Consulted with federal agencies on FedRAMP-authorized solutions. Identified 5 major vendors (Microsoft Azure, AWS, Google Cloud) and 3 HUB-certified system integrators with state government experience. Market research indicates strong competition and mature solutions available.
marketResearchDescription.notes: Summary of market research activities and findings

ditTemplateTOU.value: NCDIT Cloud Services RFP Template v3.2 with standard Terms and Conditions for SaaS/IaaS procurement including data sovereignty, security requirements, and service level agreements.
ditTemplateTOU.notes: Specific template and terms to be used in solicitation

agencySpecificTOU.value: Agency data classification policy (Policy 2024-IS-07), incident response requirements, and audit rights per agency regulation 15.3.2.
agencySpecificTOU.notes: Additional agency-specific terms that must be included

legalSupportApproach.value: Statewide DOJ Legal will provide primary legal review for contract terms and compliance. Agency Legal Counsel will review technical requirements and data handling provisions.
legalSupportApproach.notes: Description of legal support structure for the procurement

hubVendorEngagementStrategy.value: Will host pre-proposal conference with dedicated HUB vendor introduction session. Requiring prime contractors to document outreach to HUB subcontractors. Providing HUB vendor list from state database. Evaluating subcontracting plans as part of technical proposal scoring.
hubVendorEngagementStrategy.notes: Strategy to encourage HUB participation in the procurement

sourcingProjectInAriba.notes: New procurement - sourcing project not yet created in Ariba

aribaWSID.notes: Ariba workspace identifier (if project already exists)

ariba_priorContractReferences.value: Master Services Agreement MSA-2023-045 with current data center provider (expiring). Related to previous cloud assessment project WS0987654321.
ariba_priorContractReferences.notes: References to existing contracts that relate to this procurement

ariba_federalPartnersInvolved.value: Department of Homeland Security (DHS) for cybersecurity coordination, National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) for compliance framework.
ariba_federalPartnersInvolved.notes: Federal agencies involved or providing guidance

td_qualifier_projectInTouchdown.notes: Project will be created in Touchdown as part of intake process

touchdown_intakeForm.notes: Touchdown intake form required due to project scope and budget

touchdown_agencyBusinessOwner.notes: Senior agency official responsible for business outcomes

touchdown_projectOwnerEmailConfirm.notes: Confirmation of project owner email for Touchdown system

touchdownProjectName.notes: Project not yet named in Touchdown system

td_qualifier_businessCaseApproved.notes: Business case approved by agency leadership on January 15, 2026

touchdown_teamsPlannerIntegration.notes: Will use Teams and Planner for project collaboration

td_qualifier_newOrEnhancedCapability.notes: Significantly enhanced cloud and security capabilities

td_qualifier_citizenServiceInvolvement.notes: Will improve agency's ability to deliver digital services to citizens
